column4: Hey guys how do i install flash player and swfdec and gnash swf players from terminal?
when i go to certain website it asks me to install them but when i click on install it says something about broken packages but i need it as i cant see the website properly
use: http://pastie.org   to give the output, thanks
if you install them all they may fight
sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree gnash swfdec-player-0.8.0   possibly, use: apt-cache search something   to verify
ah then can you run:  sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get upgrade; sudo apt-get --reinstall install nano; echo; lsb_release -a; uname -a
if you can give the output of the command I can get your packages square again
use the link I gave, copy the page to the pastebin and hit the paste button. Copy the new address in the address bar and paste it here
pastebin is NOT ubuntu specific and can be used in any OS

run the BIG command I gave, copy the tex, go to http://pastie.org and paste the text in the BIG box. Hit the paste button then wait. When the page has changed, copy the address in the address bar of your browser and paste it here
ok what is the output of:  dpkg -l | grep flash; dpkg -l | grep swf; dpkg -l | grep gnash     thanks
seems you split the command up for some reason, the command would have outputted a LOT less, seems you don't have flash installed which is fine. Simply install flashplugin-nonfree and you are ok
run: sudo add-apt-repository ppa:sevenmachines/flash && sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install flashplugin64-installer
gives native 64bit flash rather than using nspluginwrapper nonsense
